description: A conventient extraction and measurement protocol for GUS activity from Phaeodactylum tricornutum.

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

authors: Vincent A. Bielinski and Philip D. Weyman

authors_list.name: Vincent A. Bielinski and Philip D. Weyman

components.data: Centrifuge cells for 10 min at 3,000 x g. We typically use 4-5 mL cells grown to ~1x106 cells/mL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge cells for 10 min at 3,000 x g. We typically use 4-5 mL cells grown to ~1x106 cells/mL.

components.data:
Pour off supernatant and resuspend cell pellets in 200 µL  extraction buffer. Transfer to 1.5 mL microfuge tubes. Freeze cell suspension in liquid N2 or dry ice/ethanol bath and either 1) store at -80C or 2) proceed with extraction and assay. 

 

GUS extraction buffer: 

 50 mM sodium PO4 buffer pH 7

10 µM beta-mercaptoethanol (BME)

0.1% Triton X-100
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Pour off supernatant and resuspend cell pellets in 200 µL  extraction buffer. Transfer to 1.5 mL microfuge tubes. Freeze cell suspension in liquid N2 or dry ice/ethanol bath and either 1) store at -80C or 2) proceed with extraction and assay. 

 

GUS extraction buffer: 

 50 mM sodium PO4 buffer pH 7

10 µM beta-mercaptoethanol (BME)

0.1% Triton X-100

components.data: Do a total of three freeze-thaw cycles. Freeze on liquid N2 or with dry ice/ethanol  and thaw by floating tubes in a rack in room temperature water. M
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Do a total of three freeze-thaw cycles. Freeze on liquid N2 or with dry ice/ethanol  and thaw by floating tubes in a rack in room temperature water. M

components.data: Spin down cell debris 5 min, 15,000 xg, 4 C. Transfer supernatant to a clean microfuge tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down cell debris 5 min, 15,000 xg, 4 C. Transfer supernatant to a clean microfuge tube.

components.data:
Add 190 µL GUS+MUG buffer to each well in a 96 well plate. Do each P. tricornutum sample in duplicate or triplicate, so the total number of wells needed is equal to number of samples x 2 or 3. We standard clear, flat bottom 96 well plates for this step.

 

GUS+MUG buffer: 

50 mL GUS extraction buffer + 17.6 mg MUG (4-Methylumbelliferyl-β-D-galactopyranoside)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 190 µL GUS+MUG buffer to each well in a 96 well plate. Do each P. tricornutum sample in duplicate or triplicate, so the total number of wells needed is equal to number of samples x 2 or 3. We standard clear, flat bottom 96 well plates for this step.

 

GUS+MUG buffer: 

50 mL GUS extraction buffer + 17.6 mg MUG (4-Methylumbelliferyl-β-D-galactopyranoside)

components.data: Add 10 µL clarified sample (step 4) to wells, mix by gently tapping plate. Incubate 30-90 min at 37C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 10 µL clarified sample (step 4) to wells, mix by gently tapping plate. Incubate 30-90 min at 37C.

components.data:
Prepare a stop buffer plate using a black 96-well flat bottom plate containing 180 µL stop buffer per well used in the reaction plate. 

After incubation of reaction at 37 C for required time, transfer 20 µL of each reaction to the aliquotted stop buffer plate using a multichannel pipet. Mix by gentle tapping. 

 

Stop Buffer: 0.2 M Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare a stop buffer plate using a black 96-well flat bottom plate containing 180 µL stop buffer per well used in the reaction plate. 

After incubation of reaction at 37 C for required time, transfer 20 µL of each reaction to the aliquotted stop buffer plate using a multichannel pipet. Mix by gentle tapping. 

 

Stop Buffer: 0.2 M Na2CO3 (sodium carbonate)

components.data: Settings for fluorescence detection: excitation, 360 nm, emission, 440 nm

components.data: Perform total protein quantification by BCA assay or equivalent. Normalize GUS activities to total protein.
components.name: Description
